mdRecord.dcterms:title: Circular: Lynchburg, Va., February, 1867. : To all who cherish the memory of the heroic dead, and are willing to unite in an effort to secure honorable sepulture for the Southern victims of the late war, whose remains were interred on the battle-fields of Virginia, where they fell, this circular is addressed
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Brown, E. H. Mrs
Button, Charles W.
Early, Jubal Anderson, 1816-1894
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Announcing the upcoming publication of the 2nd edition of Early's "Memoir of the last year of the war for independence, in the Confederate States of America," "for the benefit of the Ladies' Memorial Associations of Virginia, which have undertaken the work of collecting the remains and marking the graves of the Confederate dead, who fell the battle-fields of that State."

Includes "Preface to the second edition of Gen. Early's Memoir", by J.A. Early, Toronto, February 1st, 1867, and "Publisher's Preface," by Chas. W. Button, Lynchburg, Va. Queries should be addressed to the publisher, "Or Mrs. E.H. Brown, Box 452 Richmond, Va."
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: From the Morgan papers, MSS 1275, a gift of Arthur Pforzheimer to the Tracy W. McGregor Library.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Early, Jubal Anderson, 1816-1894--Memoir of the last year of the war for independence, in the Confederate States of America
